website_summaries.verdict: Offers quality and features for a fraction of the price of similar models.
pros: Award-winning adjustable model at a fraction of the price of others we reviewed
Mildew-proof padding adds comfort to the ergonomic design
cons: The shallow seat area requires extra effort to clean, but this is a small concern considering the value

customer_reviews.title: Okay, except the infant sling is not adjustable as pictured
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this with my newborn son for the past month and a half, but now that he is two months old I went to adjust the height of the sling as mentioned in the instructions... and there are no buckles on the straps at all. Both sides of the sling have fixed-length straps so it is not adjustable. This is frustrating because my son's torso is mostly out of the water and he gets cold, but he's not big enough to sit in the tub without the sling.
customer_reviews.author: Caitrin

customer_reviews.title: Easy to bathe in
customer_reviews.text: Just what I needed for my new born baby to relax in while taking a bath.
customer_reviews.author: Ronnetta Coates

customer_reviews.title: Babies weighing more than 10/12 lbs maybe too heavy for net
customer_reviews.text: My three month old is too big (weighing 15 pounds) fir this tub to use the net. Can’t use this until he can sit up. Waste of money. Should have just splurged and rebought the same $30 tub we use daily as this second tub was for our cabin. Trying to save money but total fail. If amazon didn’t penalize you for returns I would send this back. I’ll keep and use when he can sit up.
customer_reviews.author: KJAmazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sling not adjustable; inconsistent with description
customer_reviews.text: The blue version shown in the front pic has no adjustable sling, whereas the pink one does. However, the blue version in the description does have an adjustable sling The sling I received is not adjustable, and the cellotape looked like it was opened. So what I think I received is a refurbished item, with a replaced sling which unfortunately is not adjustable. The item does not deserve even the one star because of passing off a used item as a new one. The sling I received also looks too small/narrow and my baby might not be comfortable in it. If baby kicks it will find itself tumbling backward headfirst
customer_reviews.author: Gkk

customer_reviews.title: and she hated this tub because she was cold the whole time ...
customer_reviews.text: Our daughter is petite for her age and she still didnt fit well in the sling. the back of her head would be pushed up on the plastic through the sling. and she hated this tub because she was cold the whole time we used it to bathe her. cant fill with enough water to keep her warm. we ended up just getting in the tub with her and holding her. so much easier.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly Wachtmeister

customer_reviews.title: Hate this tub.
customer_reviews.text: The only thing I like about this tub is the price. We never were happy with the way the sling worked. It didn't support our baby well. Now that our 5 month old is too large for it we can't get him comfortable in either the newborn or infant/toddler side. When using the infant side our kid keeps shifting and the hump digs into his back and even left a bruise. When using the other side he just flops around too much and is not supported. Going back to the Fisher-Price 4-in-1 Sling N Seat Tub which we loved with our last kiddo.
customer_reviews.author: J1976

customer_reviews.title: More like the first few months
customer_reviews.text: This bathtub was decent at best for my daughter when she was a newborn but after 2 months it was awkward to fit her in here to bathe. I was having a hard time holding her safe in there which is not what I want to worry about while I'm bathing her. She's now 6 months and despite washing the insert and drying it properly, there are mold spots everywhere. I don't know why it's advertised for the first few years because this isn't good past 2 months imo.
customer_reviews.author: Grace

customer_reviews.title: Best way to bath baby
customer_reviews.text: Started out with one of the new expensive flowers and our baby hated it after a few tries and fails decided to get this and worked great. We have a large stand up shower with various shower heads and she loves it she. We set it on the shower floor with some of the streams coming down. It’s very comfortable and holds baby up well even when newborn. Didn’t use that cloth thing since she didn’t like it she wanted to be submerged.
customer_reviews.author: Luisa F. Cardona

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Tub
customer_reviews.text: Our baby graduated from the infant sling really quickly and this tub is perfect to accommodate her growth. Now she can sit by herself in her mini tub and play with the toys while we bathe her. She has grown to love the water and I love that this tub uses less water than our full sized tub while keeping her propped safely. It makes bathing her with only one adult a breeze. So nice that she can grow with this one - presumably until she can use the full tub. Would definitely buy again. Don't know why the pink one is cheaper, but hey, anyone can like pink. So save a few dollars and go pink.
customer_reviews.author: Maureen

customer_reviews.title: Stick with something simpler
customer_reviews.text: Truthfully, I don’t love this tub. The sling was helpful for the first 3 weeks of my baby’s life, but that’s about it. I understand the thought behind the seat options, but my 3 month old is too old for the newborn side, and not quite strong enough to sit upright on the infant/toddler side. She straightens her legs, and ends up sliding over the seat divider, and could easily slip under the water that way. I’m not a fan, and wish I’d just gotten the basic baby tub from Ikea.
customer_reviews.author: J. D.

customer_reviews.title: We enjoy bathtime with this!
customer_reviews.text: Love the versatility of this tub and how I don’t have to waste a bunch of water to use it like I did the regular bathtub! My daughter has long, strong legs but can’t hold herself up yet, so when she kicks her legs straight while sitting in the infant side she pushes her butt up and over the ledge and almost slips into the water. I know this isn’t a product defect but something to consider! Still waiting for someone to design a bathtub where you can easily lift baby forward and out of the water to really clean the little bum safely and easily!
customer_reviews.author: Maria C.

customer_reviews.title: One Major Flaw
customer_reviews.text: OK so I really wanted to like this bath and overall I think it's a great bath for different ages however there is one major flaw. On the sides of the bath there are plastic grooves to allow the water to flow through...the 1st time I used this my daughter got her foot stuck in the sides twice. She was screaming and holding her foot. I eventually figured out after the 2nd time that I needed to stuff the sides with a rag so she can't wedge her foot into the grooves. Other than that it's a great bath I just wish that they didn't have those plastic grooves where babies can possibly hurt themselves.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa MK

customer_reviews.title: Dumb Design
customer_reviews.text: Dumb design. The drain is right where the bath sits so if it’s being used, it can’t drain. You have to lift it up to drain. Stupid. Update: I emailed about the drain! They said, "When the baby is out of the tub, just lift it up to drain." When the baby is out of the tub, I don't need the drain. I can just turn it over! So dumb. #DumbTub
customer_reviews.author: Meathouse

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: I like this tub, we used it from the birth. My daugher is now four months old and we are able to wash her by leaning her to the curved side of the tub. That's a great comfort because she is not able to sit by herself yet and it is hard to keep the baby while bathing her. The only reason I gave four stars is that suction power is not very good, the water flows slowly from the tub.
customer_reviews.author: Zeynep Karasahan

customer_reviews.title: Do not recommend! Missing pieces. Not as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Didn’t come with the sling as advertised. Received the first one without it. I ask for an exchange in order to receive one with the actual sling included. But noooooo. The second one came without as well. It only includes the tub. Really bad experiencia. Do not recomend buying this if you really want the sling included as I can imagine a baby being bath directly on the tub without something in between
customer_reviews.author: Adriana

customer_reviews.title: Great for babies and convenient for parents
customer_reviews.text: I bout this product for my newborn and couldn't be happier with it. We used included sling when the baby was tiny , 9-10 lb, and then I just sat her in the bath without the sling. The bath was very comfortable for the baby, she could sit without sliding under the water and felt safe and never wined. The bath fits in the sink very well, it was very convenient to use, it was easy to rinse to keep clean, no scrubbing needed, and the Amazon price was awesome.
customer_reviews.author: ~ N ~

customer_reviews.title: Fits well in sink
customer_reviews.text: We were impressed by this tub's design - it's very stable and fits well in our sink, but has other grooves so that we can use it in the bathtub and/or differently sized sinks. The sling worked well when our daughter was newborn, and then we transitioned to the "infant" layback position in the tub itself, and now the more upright "toddler" position in the tub itself. We bought this because we needed a simple tub and this got good reviews, and were pleasantly surprised at how much thought had gone into the product itself.
customer_reviews.author: customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Baby Tub
customer_reviews.text: My pediatrician suggested this tub for me based on her experience with her own children. I wanted something inexpensive that would grow with my child. This tub totally fit the bill. I have used this in both my sink and my bathtub. My kitchen sink is rather small, but the tub still fit right in there nicely. I was a little nervous about the hammock part at first (would it be strong enough? Would my baby roll off it?), but it’s actuality pretty sturdy. I usually fill the tub so that my little guy is sitting in a bit of warm water when he’s in the hammock. He loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor DePasqua

customer_reviews.title: No go for big babies
customer_reviews.text: It should say it's not for long or big babies. I regret this purchase. My 3mo old can't sit up but he is way to big for the sling or the reclines part but can't use the sit up side either. Maybe if the tub was bigger or the recline part was longer so he reat his head on something. My son is a big boy and we've been having lots of trouble finding him a tub....
customer_reviews.author: Emma

customer_reviews.title: 2 years later, like brand new for my second child! GREAT BATH TUB!
customer_reviews.text: 2 years and 2 babies later it still looks brand new!! We've used this bathtub from the age of 2 weeks to 9 months (after which point she just sat in a regular bath tub). We've actually always used the bathtub with the sling. Both my kids love it and just lay in it and relax. Functionality: The fabric is soft and padded. The soap does not stay on it. The water pools on the bottom and you can drain it out. It is light weight and easy to transfer. We use the tub on the bathroom counter top. It does not take up much room and is super functional. Durability: As stated above this tub still looks like new.
customer_reviews.author: Simplylovelyhome

customer_reviews.title: Situational Item, useful for me.
customer_reviews.text: Honestly, if you had a bathroom in a warm part of the house, you can save money and not get this item. This tub was a fantastic fit for us because we were living in partially finished basement when our little one came along. This was a great item for us as we had to close up a room and use a space heater to keep our little one warm during the time we bathed her. Now we have moved and don't find much use for the item itself. It does occasionally come out in the summer as a giant tub for bubbles.
customer_reviews.author: Shirly

customer_reviews.title: Awesome to stick in the tub but way too big for sink
customer_reviews.text: Great for the price, will be able to use a while. We put this in the regular tub and our baby has loved it and hasn’t had much trouble with sinking down or falling over. The little shelf on the end lets us put extra stuff in there when she’s in the bath but it’s too narrow to be very useful for storing bath toys and things. This is ridiculously big to fit into a sink unless you have a double with a shorter divider in the middle.
customer_reviews.author: Weona

customer_reviews.title: The greatest tub
customer_reviews.text: We initially got a fancy waterfall summer infant tub which claimed to have a bolster suitable for newborns. Only if your newborn can sit up and weighs about fifteen pounds... So this tub was our desperate attempt to try something different and save ourselves from having to hold the baby up the entire bath. We just finished our first bath in this tub and it was a life changing experience. The baby enjoyed it, it took half the time, mom and dad didn't kill their backs with it-complete success. For this price, everyone is getting this tub for Christmas!
customer_reviews.author: UnaDHB

customer_reviews.title: Great Baby Bath
customer_reviews.text: I really enjoy using this baby bathtub! I initially used the sling that came with it which was very helpful when my daughter was a newborn. On one end of the tube you can have your baby laying for bath time (since they do not know how to sit-up) and on the other side your baby can actually sit-up on while resting their back on the tub. There is a little plug on the inside that allows you drain water and there is a little holder behind the tube for toys and what have you. I place the tub across my laundry room sink to prevent from having to constantly bend over.
customer_reviews.author: K.T.

customer_reviews.title: Warning Label Shenanigans!
customer_reviews.text: Is there no quality control in China anymore? The plastic warning label is sewn right into where the baby’s butt would sit !
customer_reviews.author: Ed B

customer_reviews.title: Love This
customer_reviews.text: I was concerned that the hammock would keep my grandson out of the water too much (and thus perhaps cold), but the weight of the baby keeps him down in the water, yet safe in the hammock. So, this is perfect! Started using this when my grandson was about 2 months old and 13 pounds. I am very sure that this will be able to be used for quite some time. At the 4 or 5 month mark, I'll stop using the hammock. The tub has a nice non-slip slanted side for good support. The drain plus is a great feature and the tub seems very sturdy. A great buy!
customer_reviews.author: Alisa

customer_reviews.title: The best baby tub
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect baby tub! I’ve tried two other options and this is the best! Great size. I’ve been using since my baby was 3 months. Actually fill it and place it on the sink (it’s the size of a double sink but has only one so we have a lot of counter space.) so no bending into the tub which is so bad for my back. If you buy this you can use it on any safe hard surface so don’t feel like you’re restricted to the tub. We love this! Going to keep it for our next baby as well!! 5 stars!!!
customer_reviews.author: Reese Dennis

customer_reviews.title: Solid and functional
customer_reviews.text: I like the durability and solid feel this tub has. I don’t like the hammock, how it clips onto the sides, and how easy it is becoming for my newborn to wiggle out of the hammock. If the hammock was a little bigger and the straps a little thicker it wouldn’t give me anxiety getting my girl into this tub. I’m giving it four stars bc these are issues that do not impede giving her a bath and this tub is very functional.
customer_reviews.author: Evan

customer_reviews.title: Had a life span of about two weeks
customer_reviews.text: I'm so bummed because this tub fit perfectly in my sink. It was at its best when my baby was an infant and used the hammock feature. It quickly went down hill as the grooved bottom and seat back are very uncomfortable. His little spin would come out all red after a quick bath. Also the drain plug is almost snapped in half after 4 months of use. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: bkmlyn

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn’t buy again
customer_reviews.text: Doesn’t drain fast enough in the bath tub I have to prop it a tiny bit so it will drain when I’m ready to rinse my baby girl. The sling is nice just wish there was more head support for my newborn and wasn’t so tight so her little body would be more in the tub than hovering above the water I feel like it will for great for her when she’s a little old and can hold her head up and doesnt need the sling anymore
customer_reviews.author: shelbie

customer_reviews.title: I don't like it!
customer_reviews.text: I don't know why this item is the top recommend for baby's shower. My kid is 5 months old now, he can't sit upright now (He always shakes). So I want put him on the infant side to take a shower. But the bulge is too close to sit. he can't sit there. I have to put him on the sling. But the sling is too small for him. In the all, I really don't like it!
customer_reviews.author: Hao Peng

customer_reviews.title: Not good for bigger babies
customer_reviews.text: I wish someone wrote a good review of the product before I bought it. We have been using it for about a month now and the baby being bigger now, it is actually getting dangerous. It is so flimsy , and while it was stationed on a kitchen sink, when my baby flapped his hands, the whole thing swung back, almost letting the baby land in the sink on his head. I dont know if it is the design flaw or the flimsiness of the plastic.
customer_reviews.author: Khaliun Chinbat

customer_reviews.title: Perfect basic tub!
customer_reviews.text: My sister in law had a fancy tub for her daughter and only used it a handful of times because it was bulky, difficult to use, and hard to clean so we knew we wanted a simple one. Sadly we bought one very similar to this for $40 and we bought this one for grandparents house for occasional use and we should just bought two of these. I think the other one was more because it came with a couple extra pieces, but nothing necessary. The best part about this tub is the little area it has to put the shampoo bottle and wash cloth (which the $40 one doesn’t even have!).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: We like it!
customer_reviews.text: I am a first time mom so I'm very picky with anything I buy for my baby bc I want it to be save and great! So I was nervous about getting this tub since I was in need of a new one, got it, used it and me and my husband are happy with it! The bet fits good and we love the holder for the wash clothes and etc only thing it's missing is a handle so it can hang dry
customer_reviews.author: Brandie Davis-White aka My Urban Books

customer_reviews.title: See review
customer_reviews.text: This is a big and bulky tub which is not necessarily a bad thing because you only need to fill the this little tub to give your little one a bath. however I feel like it's best for older babies that can sit up and toddlers . even though there is an infant sling that comes with it the baby slides around in so while you're trying to wash their hair behind their neck they're sliding down so they're sinking slowly into the water to the point where they would go all the way under the water. It should be shaped different.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Good, not perfect.
customer_reviews.text: THis is great for newborn, but around 5-7 months it's kind of annoying. the Sit-up side doesn't leave enough space for baby to sit comfortably (it is super vertical) and the reclined side is too reclined for baby to be able to pull self to sitting. The hammock was very useful for first couple of months Overall this is a good product, but isn't perfect
customer_reviews.author: Marco

customer_reviews.title: Thank god for this!
customer_reviews.text: Honestly, this is one of the best purchase ever, especially for $14.99. We have the flower petal cushion and it was too hard to wash and didn’t fit the baby right so we looked on amazon for a different bath tool and came across this. It’s absolutely amazing and our newborn loves it! She look very comfy and peaceful in it, and we’ve been using it nearly every night!
customer_reviews.author: Katie Danzer

customer_reviews.title: Sling is NOT adjustable
customer_reviews.text: The new born sling is Unadjustable!!! Why this product keep saying it's adjustable in its description... The Amazon customer service got a replacement for me and said "don't worry, I will make sure the replaced one is adjustable". BUT it's still not....
customer_reviews.author: AXIU

customer_reviews.title: What i enjoy about this tub is the mesh sling and the ...
customer_reviews.text: I had purchased this tub for my newborn in October and have been using it daily. What i enjoy about this tub is the mesh sling and the pocket on the side for shampoo and body wash. The mesh sling holds my baby securely and the pocket makes it easy for me to reach for the shampoo and body wash. However, one thing i wish the tub had was a better-designed padded head rest for babies who are still in the mesh sling for their baths. Sometimes i feel like my baby's head is positioned uncomfortably so i would often hold her neck/head for support. Overall, i think this product was worth the purchase for its price.
customer_reviews.author: PDL

customer_reviews.title: Nice tub
customer_reviews.text: The tub is great, but the newborn insert is kind of flimsy (beyond the fact that it’s supposed to be flimsy for taking on/off) and my baby keeps almost falling off. As a result, I’ve had to constantly use one hand to stabilize her, and it makes it slightly more difficult to wash her squirming body. Otherwise, the tub is great.
customer_reviews.author: Ang

customer_reviews.title: Great inexpensive tub for small infants
customer_reviews.text: Great inexpensive tub for small infants. Easy to clean. However, as our daughter grew we found she would slide down in the sling (at about 12lbs). From then on it was easier to lay her down in the big tub on a bathmat to bathe her. The only downside is that if you have double sinks of unequal sizes in your kitchen, or granite counters with undermount sink this tub may not fit if you want to use it that way.
customer_reviews.author: Sally

customer_reviews.title: 4 years and 3 babies later, still our favorite baby bathing method!
customer_reviews.text: First and last baby tub! An absolute must-have!!! I have the same tub, still in excellent condition, after three babies and we are still going strong with it! It has been all of my children's favorite way to take a bath until shortly before walking age. It has also lasted years and that is more than I could have ever hoped for. With the way products are made these days, you're lucky to get something to last a year, let alone close to 4.5 years (and three babies later). I am also impressed that the sling still holds up and the plug has not sprung a leak. Overall, best baby bath I've ever had. BUY IT BUY IT BUY IT!
customer_reviews.author: Sierra EliseTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Good value for the price
customer_reviews.text: This is the second time I am buying this bathtub for my kids; the first one worked well and lasted for a while- until my baby learned to sit and splash all over. However I think it works great for the first 6 months at least and it is a great value for the price. Also, it is easy to clean and air dry, unlike some others.
customer_reviews.author: Julia K

customer_reviews.title: The best there is
customer_reviews.text: If you’re like me, you’ve googled dozens of baby bath tubs, seen negative reviews and never committed to a tub. This is the tub to buy. No toe plastic ouchies! Two sides for different recline. Drains well. We added the sponge for comfort but it’s an awesome tub, truly.
customer_reviews.author: JenniferTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Works well for 4-month-old
customer_reviews.text: This has been great for our baby. Started using it at 4 months old, when he was about 17 lbs, so we never needed the infant hammock. I was concerned to buy this at first, because of a "bump" people talked about that went into their kids' backs. The bump is the little shelf they sit on to stay upright... Not sure how other people are laying their kids in here, but it works well in my opinion. We leave the infant hammock attached at the top, and fold it under to make a sort of pillow for him. There's never enough padding for their heads in these tubs.
customer_reviews.author: Will Arvin

customer_reviews.title: Easy to clean, comfortable for my baby!
customer_reviews.text: My three month old daughter loves this tub! She loves to relax in the little "hammock", splashing about. I like that this tub is self contained so I can wash her in the tub or on the counter, just anywhere. Then I can just release the water with a plug. It's easy to clean, and I can just throw the hammock sling in the washer. Very happy with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Christine

customer_reviews.title: Great quality baby tub
customer_reviews.text: I bought my sister the exact tub at Walmart except it was pink. She was very pleased with it so I decided to order my blue one on here because it was $7 cheaper. Baby will be here in 2 weeks and it will be put to use. We loved the little net and how well it held the baby in place and head in position. Very well made and easy to drain and clean.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Milligan

customer_reviews.title: Perfect tub
customer_reviews.text: The reviews speak for themselves. I read tons of reviews for various tubs before purchasing and went with this one, the reviews were stellar and the price was right. I don't regret it! This tub is great and easy to use and clean. I clean the infant part in my washer and did not have any issues with cleanliness (smells or mold). It fit nicely on top of my kitchen sink and is secure and safe. I felt that it is comfortable for my baby because the infant sling has some padding.
customer_reviews.author: Shoppy

customer_reviews.title: So much better
customer_reviews.text: I guess baby tubs have come a long way over the years... the last ones I remember looked like a large Tupperware container. Got this to help keep our infant clean. First try she fell in love with it, didn’t want to get out of the tub. A few different settings too on this so it can grow with your baby
customer_reviews.author: Scott Rowan

customer_reviews.title: Perfect tub
customer_reviews.text: This is the best value good and the best little tub for your little one. It’s is so cute, very convenient for both newborn and growing infant. It allows peace of mind for a parent who is giving a bath to their child with the inbuilt seat on two sodes( one for newborn one for toddler). It is the cheapest and the best solution tub ever! It is simple yet something you use every day for your child. Amazing product. If I could I’d give it a 10 star! Love love love!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not for babies who cant sit up on their own
customer_reviews.text: This tub is nice but does not work for my 6 month old. She is too big to use the sling. We have tried sitting her on both sides of the tub and she is either sliding down or slumping over so I am constantly having to readjust her. This tub would be well suited for infants and babies who can sit up on their own. I will most likely use this when my baby has mastered the skill of sitting up on her own better.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Lijewski

customer_reviews.title: Newborn aspect of this isn’t the beat
customer_reviews.text: This bath is alright. The sling part for newborns is a little pointless to me since newborns don’t need a bath but once or twice while they still have umbilical stump and in reality he didn’t need a bath at all since his fell off at 6 days. The newborn side that you use once baby is able to be in water should lean back a bit more or have something to help hold head in place otherwise it’s hard to give a bath without help. I’m sure it will be great once he can sit up more and hold head sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Good tub for older baby
customer_reviews.text: The newborn sling is awkward to work with. It's better now that my baby is sitting with support. There is a reclined seat for 3-5 month old and a straight backed seat for an older baby. I also love the bright color. No problems with cleaning, no mold or mildew odors. I just rinse it and let it air dry. Occasionally I use a Clorox wipe on it.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Esposito

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: This is by far the best tub you can buy for your baby! We tried others and quickly got tired of bending over the bathtub. This is used in our kitchen sink and it fits great, no more back ache after bath time. The price just makes it even better, give it a try and I think you will agree.
customer_reviews.author: DR

customer_reviews.title: easy to use
customer_reviews.text: lightweight, easy to use. really easy to clean if your baby poops in the tub (surprise!) it would be nice if it came with a hook or something to hang it up when not in use, though, because it is kind of bulky. It fits really well on the kitchen sink, but does not fit over the bathroom sink and is very unstable. we thought maybe it would just span the bathroom sink and sit firmly on the counter, but it is all lopsided and tipsy. we either put it in the kitchen sink or lay it in the bathtub
customer_reviews.author: K.T.

customer_reviews.title: Great baby shower gift.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this one for friend’s new born. This is a great tub for new born to young babies. For a new born who’s too soft to sit in the tub, the mesh net gives support for the parents to wash. So the parent doesn’t have to worry about baby slip into water and drown. It’s especially good for new parents. It’s easier to get a hang of bathing a baby with the mesh. When babies are a little older, they can sit in the little tub and take a bath. Also it’s a good price for a baby shower gift.
customer_reviews.author: siyuan morton

customer_reviews.title: A good little bathtub
customer_reviews.text: It's a good little baby bathtub. Does the trick. Light and small enough that I can use it outside the bathtub (so I don't have to reach down to bath baby, I can just sit on the floor and be at the same level). Easy enough to clean. Comfortable for the babies, they both love it.
customer_reviews.author: andrew crawford

customer_reviews.title: Leaks from plug
customer_reviews.text: Not the best tub for newborns. My baby keeps sliding down on the sling. We used the tub once inside the shower and didn’t notice that it leaked after it is plugged. We ended up using epoxy is seal it and we’ll just have to dump the water manually. It wouldn’t have been a problem if we used it in an adult bathtub or shower, but if you plan to put it on the floor anywhere else like we do now, there is a puddle of water after using it.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Good for price
customer_reviews.text: I think baby tubs are very hard to use but as baby tubs go this one does what it’s supposed to. The net that you attach for newborns is extremely hard to use in my opinion. It makes it very hard to wash baby. I think this is a good price and works good so if you do want a baby bath then this one will work
customer_reviews.author: AmberS

customer_reviews.title: I really love how it fits onto the sink
customer_reviews.text: I really love how it fits onto the sink. Very convenient. I also like how there is a place to put the soap/shampoo. The only issue I have is the newborn sling. Once it gets wet it stretches and the baby's back ends up on the hump thats inside the tub and I can imagine how uncomfortable it is so I end up supporting them through the sling. Once my babies are bigger and I don't need the sling anymore, I think this will be a great product!
customer_reviews.author: Ashleen T.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent price to value ratio
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent value in a tub. I wish someone had told us to buy a tub that could go in the sink much sooner. I hate the ones that sit inside the tub; bending over and trying to hold a slippery baby in a safe position is a nightmare. For 12 or so dollars you can't beat this. Our daughter is transitioning into the upright phase rather than reclined and it is still working fine. I never had much use for the hammock deal, but it doesn't hurt to have.
customer_reviews.author: Cale P.

customer_reviews.title: Good Tub
customer_reviews.text: Good quality material, easy to put together. Only negative thing about this tub is whoever made these needs to make the safety tag smaller, it cover the majority of the net that holds the baby. Instead of a 5x7 safety tag make the tag like the size of a index card
customer_reviews.author: Malcolm Smith

customer_reviews.title: This tub was good for the first couple months when using the hammock
customer_reviews.text: This tub was good for the first couple months when using the hammock. When my baby was little I was still worried because he would slide down in the hammock and it was hard to keep him from going underwater. Now that he is bigger and doesn't use the hammock the one inclined side he slips off of and the other side where he just sits normal the bump in the bottom for the incline side makes it hard to sit flat. There is also a lot of places in the bathtub for water to sit and it's hard to keep clean.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Foulger

customer_reviews.title: SEWN IN STIFF SCRATCHY TAG
customer_reviews.text: Only tub I use with a baby because it’s so easy, HOWEVER now there’s this stiff scratchy tag at the bottom that is sewn on and can’t be taken off... going to try to still use it since the tag is at the bottom but hate it on there and might still take it back if he cries when on it. Thought other should know as well.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonMom123

customer_reviews.title: Fits into our Kitchen Sink, making it so much easy to bath Kid!
customer_reviews.text: The biggest plus for us is that it fits into our Kitchen Sink, making it super easy to use. We can stand and bath our Kid taking as much time needed, without being tired bending down. The suction is also good, we can open the bottom valve and it drains water quickly.
customer_reviews.author: R3

customer_reviews.title: Perfect.
customer_reviews.text: Has a nice and secure hammock for newborn that allows just enough water to get through. Also has a toddler seat side and a reclining side for younger babies. Love the top bowl part that allows to keep wash cloths wet and warm without losing them in the bath.
customer_reviews.author: Megan

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: We have been using this for our newborn for a few months now and we absolutely love it. Our little one enjoys baths and this has made things very easy for us. The tub is light but very study and stores easily. I love the drain feature, as you don’t have to take baby out to change water (if you need to) I use the little tub for toys etc to fill more water in. It’s a great feature as you can test how hot/cold water is before it touches baby.
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: Good item but not for me
customer_reviews.text: The tub was fine but I wasn’t crazy about all the departments the bottom as separated into. I have a toddler boy that likes to kick around the water durning bath time but the raised parts at the bottom of the tub limited his ability to stretch out his legs. I returned and got another one that had a flat bottom
customer_reviews.author: Sunieta Dyer

customer_reviews.title: Just as good as the costlier brand!!
customer_reviews.text: This is great! I’m tall and when bathing my LO it’s such a pain in my back to lean over the tub. Now I can use this over our sink and have quick and easy access to the water source in the process! And she likes being closer to my face while getting a bath. I love the quick drain plug and the mesh hammock is easy to clean. I looked at an almost identical bath to this made by Fischer Price but this seems just as good and was half the cost! 👍
customer_reviews.author: Christina Wells

customer_reviews.title: Best tub for this price --- now bath time is fun time!!
customer_reviews.text: I love this product. My baby fits nicely in this tub. It makes bath time very easy. My son has used it since his first bath and now he is 8 months and still using it. He loves his bath time. This tub has great features - •padded "hammock/sling" which attaches easily to the tub and make it easier for you to give bath to your baby. •adjustable strap which helps to use sling as your baby grows from newborn to couple months old. •caddy to hold baby shampoo and toys. •fits very well to kitchen sink. •easy to clean. Totally recommended product for newborn to toddlars...
customer_reviews.author: Ritz

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: I love this tub! The only thing i wasnt really thrilled about was the hammock deal for the new borns. I dont know for me it just wasnt it it was weird and awkward and i felt like my baby was uncofortable also. As soon as i took ot out and just used the newborn side of the tub bath time was so much more easy and enjoyable! I never used one of these with my first born always just gave her a bath in the sink but i do love this!
customer_reviews.author: Brittany bolliger

customer_reviews.title: Not perfect
customer_reviews.text: At first when my baby was 1 month it waa good..the net hold properly and she fit it well...not she is 3 month...she not longer fit well in the net and can fall out of it if she moves and also its not strong enough she weights 10lb and her buttom hits with a part on the buttom of the tub and hurst her and leave her a red mark and she still does not have the age to sit directly on the tub. Net not strong enough and the whole tub should be padded for softness
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: Steady hammock for infants
customer_reviews.text: I bought this one to keep at the grandparents home and it happens to be so much easier to use for an infant than the more expensive one we have at our home. The hammock is sturdy and keeps the baby higher up and well supported. I prefer this one but not sure about when they get older. My other one does have an extra piece that is a seat that I like for when baby can sit up. If I couldn’t blend the two that would be great. But, very happy with this one.
customer_reviews.author: Manuel Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: I love this tub
customer_reviews.text: I love this tub. I've used it for all 3 of my kids and it hasn't disappointed me yet. I love that it comes with a hammock for tiny, new babies.. And once they outgrow that feature, they can use the "newborn" side and eventually grow into the toddler side. So you don't have to purchase any other tub in the future. My toddler likes to play in here with all the bubbles and its comfortable for him. He always looks forward to bathtime in this!
customer_reviews.author: Mir704

customer_reviews.title: The gap between the head rest and the tub is dangerous
customer_reviews.text: There is a gap between the headrest and the side of the tub. Our 2 month old is too big to fit in the sling, and if we keep him in the tub, his head keeps going to the side, and we feat it will hit the side of the tub in the gap. This might be better for infants (in the sling) or older kids who can hold their neck properly. Not recommended for 2-4 month olds.
customer_reviews.author: Varun Puranik

customer_reviews.title: Just add Baby...
customer_reviews.text: This is the most basic of all baby tubs, but it does the job beautifully. My son is now a very hefty 25 pound 8 month old and he still uses the toddler side with room to grow. We've used this tub with no trouble since we brought him home from the hospital. There are n fancy bell or whistles, but the infant sling keep little babies safe and comfortable. They lay down position works until baby can sit up steadily on his own and the toddler side works for anything after that. We store this tub on a hook behind the bathroom door with no trouble. I'm so glad we chose to buy this tub over anything fancier.
customer_reviews.author: Kmumbarger

customer_reviews.title: The best baby tub!
customer_reviews.text: As a first time mom, this baby tub is the best that you can get. My baby girl was 7Lbs when she was born and didnt even used the soft mesh that comes with it. My baby laid comfortably on the new born side. Now she is 2 months old and she fits in it even better. In my experience, I haven't find any problem with this product. If I had go buy it again, I wouldn't hasitate to do so. It fits perfectely over the kitchen sink. If you are a first time mom and are on the search for a baby tub, take this one and you won't regret it.
customer_reviews.author: Juan Campos

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Great for newborn. After he hit about 3 months the sling was to small and the little ridge in the bottom of the tub was too small. He'd just slide right over it, so I was constantly picking him back up. Bought a new one instead of battling until he could sit on his own.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie Schaeffer

customer_reviews.text: Wanted a simple bath for my baby never really bought one for my other 2 kids but my mom said I should it work but i notice if I use the sling the bottom part rubs against my babies back a it hurts him so i kinda just stopped using it ill see if it works for him when he's older.
customer_reviews.author: Cynra

customer_reviews.title: NEWBORN BABY NEAR ROLLS OUT...:/ TOO SKINNY
customer_reviews.text: I knocked off a star because the sling is skinny. My 8lb baby near rolls off side even with my one hand on her while washing. It's not my fave for this reason. Baby is here and I need a tub so I won't return it...but that's my review. Love the color...etc.
customer_reviews.author: Anna S

customer_reviews.title: It ended up not quite fitting my sinks but luckily ...
customer_reviews.text: It ended up not quite fitting my sinks but luckily I could still prop it steady. It's definitely big enough to last the baby well into toddler age and the sling helped at the beginning for my newborn but we find it easier to just hold the baby in a sitting position without the sling when we give her a bath (but of course you need another person to help you out then). For the price it's worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Mahisha

customer_reviews.title: Great baby bath
customer_reviews.text: Great baby bath: inexpensive, functional, and we really like the sling for our little 6 month old - it is supportive for her as she lounges in her tiny tub! We have a bigger, fancier 4Moms tub too, but this is 1/3 the price and makes bathing just as easy.
customer_reviews.author: NWP

customer_reviews.title: Not enough cushion
customer_reviews.text: So I love this tub. My son is loving bath time more each day. The only downfall in this is that my son is a newborn and when bathing him I have to put a towel or a shirt to comfort his head when he is on the sling. I feel as if the small amount of cushion it has isn’t enough for his small fragile head. Other than that, it’s a great size and can be stored easily.
customer_reviews.author: Lala Rubio

customer_reviews.title: So-so.
customer_reviews.text: I do like this product but I think I might’ve ordered it without thinking. I moved to a house where i can’t really bathe baby in the sink. I’ve had to set this in the big tub and it’s kind of a pain. Baby also doesn’t sit well in the sling. It’s kind of awkward. My biggest complaint is that I can’t fit a cup in between the baby and the wall of the tub to get water to dump on her. I’m able to bath my daughter but it’s not as easy as I was hoping.
customer_reviews.author: Sonya Trueblood

customer_reviews.title: Really great product and costumer service
customer_reviews.text: I’m only putting 4 stars because it’s been a few times that I’ve used it and I think that It has to last a long time for me to put 5 stars. I will also like for them to have more colors. It is comfortable for my baby and it perfectly does it’s job. It arrived really fast and in great condition.
customer_reviews.author: Zitlaly

customer_reviews.title: Lil Mermaid
customer_reviews.text: My granddaughter used to cry during her baths. She's 4months old, so no need for the mesh. But she loves her baths. A giggling little darling. My kids find it easy to set up and clean up. No more water mess in the bathroom anymore!
customer_reviews.author: Sgt Momma

customer_reviews.title: I wasted nearly an hour of scraping to get it off ...
customer_reviews.text: This makes bathtime a breeze for baby! I just wish the huge ugly sticker on the side was easier to peel off. I wasted nearly an hour of scraping to get it off and there is still some ugly adhesive residue (yes, I realize I could have left it on, but once I started I couldn't stop). Baby is 5 months old and not yet sitting on her own, so the sling is a big help. Love that this will transition with her as she gets older/bigger.
customer_reviews.author: Eddy the Pup

customer_reviews.title: Overall happy with this product
customer_reviews.text: Over all this is good product, i am liking this and using daily to give bath to my daughter. they says it comes with a comfortable sling, that is true but i did not like quality of sling, Initially it looks comfortable, but after using around 3 weeks now sling is very loose and there is no way i can make it little tight so that my baby can seat comfortable. Suggestion to maker of this product is that there should be a way to make sling loose or tight based on need. otherwise this is good product.
customer_reviews.author: JMD_Rocks

customer_reviews.title: Nice tub, a little small
customer_reviews.text: Baby likes it. It’s slightly smaller than the fisher price one we have though, and at two months the baby is already too big for the hammock. I like the ridge on the side for keeping your baby shampoo etc while you give the bath.
customer_reviews.author: Solanacea

customer_reviews.title: Good buy for price
customer_reviews.text: Fits my almost 4 month old well. Easy to put in the regular bathtub or leave on the kitchen counter to bath her. Gives her plenty of room to splash around and is comfortable for her to sit or lay in. Great deal for the price. Wish I would have had it sooner to use when she was a little newborn.
customer_reviews.author: kms0904

customer_reviews.title: Love this tub’s infant sling. Works great!
customer_reviews.text: This baby bath tub works great. I tried the foam flower thing that goes in the sink before my baby’s belly button stump came off and it was a big pain in the butt! I had to use one hand to support her head and only had one hand free to wash her. This tub with its infant sling is MUCH easier. Wish I would have used it in the first place and not wasted money on the flower one!
customer_reviews.author: fclemmons

customer_reviews.title: Missing items
customer_reviews.text: Item came with Ripped packaging and no sling inside. I feel like I got jipped and ripped off. I know that’s a small problem but if I paid for it I’d like to have everything that I purchased so I’m disappointed. My baby is due any day now. Hopefully this can be resolved and seller can send me a sling to go with the tub. If so I’ll definitely update my rating and review. The tub seems like it will be great for baby to grow with but for now I’m just disappointed in this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for newborns to 5-6 months
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for a newborn - hammock keeps belly button high above water line. Granddaughter is now 2 months old and we removed the hammock so she has enough water to kick and splash her feet. It has enough of a non slip surface to keep her from sliding down. She will be able to use it for several more months at least.
customer_reviews.author: Sandy

customer_reviews.title: I really wanted to like this product but I would say stick to something ...
customer_reviews.text: This was not a practical product for me. First, it's very hard to drain the tub -- you practically have to lift it off the ground in order to drain the water out. This is not convenient as you are trying to wash your baby and you have to lift up the child in order to lift the tub off the ground. I really wanted to like this product but I would say stick to something else that's more practical.
customer_reviews.author: Cal Lawyer

customer_reviews.title: Great for newborns
customer_reviews.text: Great for babies of all sizes. Our sink wasn’t big enough for bath time so this was a life saver. The mesh insert was perfect for washing our newborn. My son loves the mesh insert sling, we went from hating bath time to loving it.
customer_reviews.author: Amelia

customer_reviews.title: Love this tub - I have 3 kids and am ...
customer_reviews.text: Love this tub - I have 3 kids and am on my 3rd one. (Four years between each kid, so I had gotten rid of it both times). Truly is newborn to toddler. It's a little bit cumbersome for a small bathroom but not as bad as others I've seen, and it's inexpensive. Perfect to get you through bathing baby from their first sponge bath until they can sit up in the bathtub.
customer_reviews.author: Kristy V.

customer_reviews.title: Buy this!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing! Highly Recommend this because it drains really well and each side of the tub has a different seating position depending on the child’s age. One is leaned back for a child that can’t hold them selves up properly and the other one kiddo can sit in once they can put them selves up. It’s amazing
customer_reviews.author: MS

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I love this bath. I had researched multiple baths for my newborn daughter and ended up picking this one. I place her down and she doesn’t slide down or to the side (she’s not a wiggly baby) works great in our sink. Fits perfectly. I made sure to look at the dimensions of my sink and this tub before buying it
customer_reviews.author: johanna vasquez

customer_reviews.title: Horrible.  So bad it is unusable.
customer_reviews.text: When I opened this I saw that the foam pads had fallen off and would not stick back on. I didn't really need those but it was obviously cheap. Then I tried to actually use it and the stopper wouldn't stay in, leaking water all over the place. Had to throw it away because it was past the return date and will now have to go out and buy another tub. Horrible quality, couldn't even use it once.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Newborns yes, babies NO!
customer_reviews.text: This bath is perfect for newborns and I loved using it for my newborn with the sling. However now that he’s four months old the bump does NOT “keep the tiny Tushy from sliding.” He slides down mid bath at least three times and freaks me out by almost submerging himself in water plus having the bump slide along his back. I will probably like this again when he’s old enough to sit on it on the other side but until then it doesn’t seem like a safe product at this point.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

product_meta.title: The First Years Sure Comfort Deluxe Newborn to Toddler Tub Pink
product_meta.description:
Color:PinkThe Sure Comfort Newborn to Toddler Tub with Infant Sling grows with your child through three stages. The included mesh sling cradles newborns to provide them with extra comfort and support while bathing. The added security of the form-fitting netting helps make bath time less stressful for both new parents and their newborn. This 3-in-1 bath tub also features a deep ergonomic design that holds a growing baby better during bath time. Removing the sling gives you a baby tub with a comfortable recline and padded headrest. The specially designed bump built into the baby side of the tub will help keep that tiny bum from sliding down. Later, active toddlers can sit up comfortably and have room to play on the toddler side. The Sure Comfort’s grow-with-baby design ensures you’ll be able to use this baby bathtub from infant through to toddler! Sling can be found on the back of the package contained within a plastic bag with instructions.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
All the security, comfort and convenience parents and growing babies need in a tub. Its deep ergonomic design holds baby better for bathing, and parents will love that it fits both single and double sinks. Plus, the mildew-resistant pads make for a cleaner bath and a special drain plug changes color to alert parents if the water is too hot for baby. From newborn to toddler, bath time couldn't be better. This deluxe version includes mesh sling.
feature_bullets: BABY BATH TUB: Three stages of transition from newborn to toddler, comes with a comfortable sling
ERGONOMIC DESIGN: This bath tub for baby features an Infant hammock like sling inside the tub and holds a growing baby better during bath time
COMFORTABLE NEWBORN BATH: Mesh sling provides extra support and comfort during first bath times
TODDLER BATH: Toddlers are supported on the upright side of the baby tub with plenty of room to play
EASY CLEAN: Mesh sling is machine washable and dryable, and anti-slip pads are mildew-resistant
Mesh sling can be found on the back of the package contained within a plastic bag with assembly instructions

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars9,394 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
